intro: Pseudibatia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian false heather, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in montane forests or high-altitude grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pseudibatia boliviensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
